description.narrative: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased evidence-generation and data gathering and analysis informs nutrition programming

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations.

description.narrative: Implementation, evaluation and scale up of effective, targeted and high impact HIV prevention and treatment interventions for adolescents and young people (AYP), including those living with HIV, undertaken. Through innovation, technology and digital platforms over 165,000 young people across the country were reached with key information and services. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of adolescents and young people reached across the country with key HIV, SRH and GBV information, including referrals to services.
Percentage of districts are implementing at least 3 high impact adolescent prevention interventions
Number of districts supported to develop/incorporate priority adolescent HIV interventions in action plans
Adolescents 15-19 who were tested for HIV and received their results in the past 12 months
Percentage of adolescents (10-19 years) on antiretroviral therapy among all adolescents living with HIV
Supporting implementation of at least three high-impact gender-responsive adolescent prevention intervention

actual.value: 2019:Two high impact interventions for adolescents and young people being supported (Comprehensive models of care; shuga radio, peer education and 124 platform.

title.narrative: Behavior change communication platform targeting adolescents and using T4D developed

baseline.value: SYes - Shuga radio programmed scaled up and U-Report rolled out

target.value: 2020:Shuga radio season two produced, shuga peer education programme implemented in 4 districts, ICT 124 platform with interactive game developed, 60,000 U-Reporters registered.

actual.value: 2019:Shuga phse one completed, phase two initiated. U-Report rolled with 18,000 U-Reporters registered to-date
